Everything you need to know about Devon's foul-mouthed Big Brother toff Arthur Fulford By WMN_PGoodwin | Posted: June 06, 2017 0 COMMENTS SHARES Arthur Fulford has already caused a stir after hitting the free drinks Everything you need to know about Devon's foul-mouthed Big Brother toff Arthur... X 
Copy link to paste in your message / Comments (0) 
The Big Brother house has opened its doors to a host of contestants for its 18th series but some of the faces are familiar. 
Devon aristocrat Arthur Fulford has starred in several reality shows with his father Lord Fulford before entering the most famous house in reality TV. 
But who is Arthur Fulford? 
Francis Arthur Fulford is 24-years-old - prior to BB he appeared in two reality shows with his family, The F***ing Fulfords and Life of Toff. 
His father is Lord Francis Fulford and the family live on the Great Fulford estate in Dunsford. 

Read more : Crime czar set to appoint old Tory council colleague as deputy 

Last month he flipped his car in a drink-driving related incident after a village cricket match, jumping into and crashing his parent's run-around after having sunk five pints. 
When police visited the family home he claimed he had alcohol after the crash, sinking four-fifths of a bottle of wine to deal with the shock. 
He told them: "You don't roll a car and not have a drink afterwards." 
The courier, who lives in London, tried to beat the breathalyser by arguing that he was below the limit when he got behind the wheel but magistrates banned him for a year. 
It took just hours for Arthur to cause a stir in the Big Brother house, after apparently enjoying the welcome beverages a little too much. 
After a few glasses, he first began to strip off before jumping into the pool in his boxers, swearing before the watershed. 
He later tried - and failed - to dress a mannequin in the house in his clothes, as some of the other housemates began to get concerned about his behaviour. 
Although others positively encouraged Arthur who went on to break Big Brother's mannequin into bits in the garden. 
"This is Big Brother, housemates must not dismantle the mannequins," Big Brother boomed into the house. 
As well as getting Big Brother angry, Arthur's antics also didn't impress some of his fellow housemates, including People's Housemate Tom Barber. 
Tom, who was voted into the house by viewers, admitted in a Facebook live chat that he was annoyed by Arthur's actions including taking a lot of the booze for himself. 
And annoying Tom probably isn't a good thing, with him in charge of this week's nominations. 
Tom, who will get to regularly communicate with the public, will have to decide half of the house to exile. 

These housemates will be at risk of eviction in Friday night's next live show. 
When is Big Brother on Channel 5? 
Big Brother 18 launched with special live show yesterday, at 8:30pm on Monday June 5, and will be shown nightly on Channel 5. 
On weeknights, the reality show generally airs at 10pm, lasting for an hour, with spin-off show Big Brother's Bit on the Side following straight after. 
However, on Fridays, Saturdays and Sundays the fun kicks off at 9.00pm, with the live eviction shows airing on Friday nights. 

Read more: Tribute to three 'fantastic young men' who died in A38 van crash 

Big Brother typically lasts around two months, with last year's series the shortest in the show's history, lasting just 50 days. 
This year's show is series expected to run for about the same length of time, though nothing is set in stone yet. 
Who is presenting Big Brother 18? 
Emma Willis returns to her hosting duties for the 18th series of Big Brother, having begun her stint on the show back in 2013. 
The outrageous Rylan Clarke-Neal is continuing at the helm of popular spin-off show Big Brother's Bit on the Side. 
Where is the Big Brother house and what does it look like? 
The Big Brother house is in the Elstree studios in Borehamwood, Hertfordshire, a 22 minute train journey from London Kings Cross Station. 
This year, the house's theme has been inspired by the General Election and Brexit. 
Big Brother 18's official title is The United Kingdom of Big Brother, and the house has been given a kitsch makeover, with rooms inspired by various aspects of British culture. 
A twist will see housemates forced to live and sleep in separate spheres in the house, in keeping with the series' class-oriented theme, The United Kingdom of Big Brother. 
Those sleeping in the grotty bedroom will have to deal with graffiti on the walls and furnishings, rickety wooden bed frames, a dirty carpet, old hand-me-down bedding and minimal storage. 
Meanwhile the luxury bedroom is the definition of cosy, with beautiful turquoise walls, animal imagery, pristine bedding and a homey atmosphere. 
This year the house is split into rich and poor sectors 
How long has Big Brother been running? 
The Big Brother reality TV concept originated in the Netherlands, with the first series airing in 1997. 
Following its success, the show came to the UK in 2000, with Craig Phillips the British version's first winner. 
After 11 series on Channel 4, Big Brother moved to Channel 5 in 2011, where it has remained ever since. 
The show has provided some of the most controversial moments in reality TV history, and catapulted the likes of Jade Goody, Nikki Grahame and Chanelle Hayes to fame.
